capability.name: Letter Of Credit
capability.definition: This Service Domain handles the pricing and issuance of letters of credit to its corporate customers in support of their international trading requirements
capability.role: Orchestrate the pricing and issuance of Letters of Credit to bank customers guaranteeing their ability to pay sellers for goods that are to be delivered at some future date. Letters of Credit are mostly used to facilitate international trade. They can be single transaction or revolving and can also be transferable and so traded (this Service Domain only covers the issuance and processing of the LoC)
capability.example: A bank issues an LC to a corporate customer to enable them to make a large purchase from an overseas supplier
